Title:
Jennwenomyces, a new hyphomycete genus producing
versicoloured phragmospores from percurrently proliferating
conidiophores
Keywords:
freshwater fungi, Miscanthus floridulus, phylogenetics,
schizolytic conidial secession, systematics
Abstract:
Jennwenomyces is described as a new hyphomycete genus,
including four species. Jennwenomyces chiayiensis and J. quadriseptatus
are new species from decaying culms of Miscanthus floridulus submerged
in freshwater streams of Alishan area, Chiayi County, Taiwan.
Jennwenomyces cylindroellipsoideus and J. navicularis are new
combinations, which are transferred from Endophragmiella
cylindroellipsoidea and Belemnospora navicularia, respectively. Species
of Jennwenomyces produce dematiaceous, versicoloured, straight,
navicular to cylindrical euseptate phragmospores from multiple
percurrently proliferating, annellate conidiophores. Conidial secession
in this genus is schizolytic, leaving a flushed hilum at the base of the
conidium. The genus is compared with similar hyphomycete genera with
percurrent conidiophores such as Belemnospora, Endophragmiella,
Junewangia, Repetophragma, and Sporidesmiella. The phylogenetic
relationship of J. chiayiensis and J. quadriseptatus was sought among
representative taxa from various fungal families by comparing the
sequences of their nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS barcode) and the partial
segment of the large subunit. A key to the four species Jennwenomyces is
given.
